description: Try this easy egg fried rice recipe that uses Chinese sausage and juicy prawns. You can have it ready for lunch or dinner in 20 minutes.
keywords: Fried rice,Low saturated fat,Sausage,Prawn,Egg,Weeknight dinner,Low sugar,Summer,High protein,High fibre,Rice,Quick & easy lunch,Autumn,Apr 2021
name: Egg Fried Rice Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 6 tbs free range eggs, lightly beaten
400g medium green prawns, peeled, deveined, tails intact
1 long red chilli, thinly sliced diagonally

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a wok or large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add half the oil, swirling to coat. Add egg and cook, breaking up egg into large chunks, for 2 minutes or until browned lightly. Transfer to heatproof bowl and set aside.

Heat remaining oil in same pan over high heat. Add sausage and prawns, then stir-fry for 2 minutes or until sausage has browned and prawns are almost cooked through. Add garlic and half of the chilli, then stir-fry for 1 minute or until fragrant.

Add rice, sauces, peas and two-thirds of the onion, reserving green part of onion, then stir-fry for 2 minutes or until heated through. Stir in egg and serve topped with remaining onion and chilli. Tip: Replace dried Chinese sausages (or lup chong), available in the Asian section, with 150g chopped rindless middle bacon rashers.
